author: Maria Iqbal - Staff Reporter
description: Some quick-service spots introduce gratuities as other restaurants drop them and experts weigh in on whether to tap.
title: Is tipping spreading or dying out? Canadian customers see both happening
content:

author: Paul Withers
description: Tonnes of atmospheric measuring equipment are being flown to Sable Island for the fog project commissioned by the US Office of Naval Research.
title: Scientists hope to clear the air of fog mystery with Grand Banks mission
content:
A major scientific field study of marine fog off the east coast of Canada is about to start.
The research is funded by the U.S. Department of Defense and hopes to better predict one of the most unpr… [+3819 chars]

author: Amanda Coletta
description: The Canadian government won't turn away Americans seeking abortions, but long distances between clinics, providers stretched thin and difficulties with cross-border travel, it might not be much of a solution.
title: Barriers to abortion in Canada make it an unlikely haven for Americans
